H0.text: Inertia is the force that a rocket must act against as it travels toward space and moves away from Earth.

H1.text: Gravity is the force a rocket must act against as it moves away from Earth while traveling toward space.

H2.text: Magnetism is the force that a rocket traveling toward space must act against as it moves away from Earth.

H3.text: Momentum is the force that a rocket traveling toward space must act against as it moves away from Earth.

A4.text: When launching from a planet, tiny accelerations cannot overcome the planet's gravitational pull and so cannot be used.

A5.text: The rate of change of velocity is called acceleration and the rate of change of momentum is called force.
